questions.question: What is a globe?
options: A flat map of the Earth
A spherical model of the Earth
questions.explanation: A globe is a spherical model that represents the Earth in its true shape.

questions.question: What are the imaginary lines running from North to South pole called?
questions.explanation: Meridians are imaginary lines running from the North Pole to the South Pole.

questions.question: What is the value of the Prime Meridian in degrees?
questions.explanation: The Prime Meridian is at 0° longitude.

questions.question: What are parallels of latitude?
questions.explanation: Parallels are imaginary circles running parallel to the equator from East to West.

questions.question: What is the value of the Equator in degrees?
Which hemispheres are created by the Equator?
questions.explanation: The Equator divides Earth into Northern and Southern hemispheres.

questions.question: What is the maximum value of latitude?
questions.explanation: The maximum value of latitude is 90 degrees (at the poles).

questions.question: What is the maximum value of longitude?
questions.explanation: The maximum value of longitude is 180 degrees (East or West).

questions.question: Which line of latitude is also known as the Tropic of Cancer?
questions.explanation: The Tropic of Cancer is located at 23.5°N latitude.

questions.question: Which line of latitude is also known as the Tropic of Capricorn?
questions.explanation: The Tropic of Capricorn is located at 23.5°S latitude.
